com.b2international.commons

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.b2international.commons.StringUtils

  • public class StringUtils
extends Object
    Contains utility methods for manipulating strings.

      • capitalizeFirstLetter

        public static String capitalizeFirstLetter(String word)
        Capitalizes the first letter of the passed in string. If the passed word is an empty word or contains only whitespace characters, then this passed word is returned. If the first letter is already capitalized returns the passed word. Otherwise capitalizes the first letter of the this word.
        Parameters:
        word -
        Returns:

      • lowerCaseFirstLetter

        public static String lowerCaseFirstLetter(String arg)
        Transforms the first letter of the argument into a lower case. If the argument is an empty string or contains only whitespace characters, then returns with the argument. If the first letter is already lower cased it returns the argument.
        Parameters:
        arg - the string to lower case the first letter.
        Returns:
        the modified string

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(String string)

      • getLine

        public static String getLine(String string,
                             String separator,
                             int lineNumber)
        Gets the specified line from string. A null separator will leave the string as-is, with only 1 line available.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to split
        separator - the separator to split the lines by, e.g. "\n"
        lineNumber - index of line to return, starting with 0
        Returns:
        specified line, or null if string is null, or lineNumber falls our of range.

      • trimIfNotNull

        public static String trimIfNotNull(String string)
        Trims a string if it is not null.
        Parameters:
        string -
        Returns:

      • toString

        public static String toString(Iterable<?> iterable)
        Adds the string representation of the first 10 elements of an Iterable to a string builder separated by commas, and appends a remaining item count, useful for Object.toString() output when the iterable's size is expected to be large. String.valueOf(Object) is used for converting individual iterable elements to their string representation.
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable to convert (may not be null)
        Returns:
        a comma separated list of the first 10 elements of the iterable and a remaining item count as a string

      • containsNumeric

        public static boolean containsNumeric(String s)
        Returns true if the specified string contains at least one single numeric character. Otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to check. Can be null. If null this method returns true.
        Returns:
        true if specified string contains numeric character.

      • removeDiacriticals

        public static String removeDiacriticals(String s)
        Turns accented characters in the specified string into their non-accented counterparts.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to convert (may not be null)
        Returns:
        the de-accented string

      • equalsIgnoreCase

        public static boolean equalsIgnoreCase(String[] first,
                                       String[] second)
        Compares if the two arrays of Strings are equal on an item-by-item basis, without taking case differences into account.
        Parameters:
        first - the first array to compare (may be null; items may be null)
        second - the second array to compare (may be null; items may be null)
        Returns:
        true if the String arrays are equal, ignoring case differences, false otherwise

      • getWords

        public static Iterable<String> getWords(String s)

      • isSingleWord

        public static boolean isSingleWord(String s)

      • endsWithDigit

        public static boolean endsWithDigit(String s)

      • valueOfOrEmptyString

        public static String valueOfOrEmptyString(Object object)
        Returns with an empty string is the argument is null otherwise returns with String.valueOf(Object).
        Parameters:
        object - an object.
        Returns:
        empty string is the object is null otherwise with the Object.toString() of the argument.
